context: ...we can read of that in 1 Chronicles 5 as the genealogy is given...

In 1 Chronicles 5 and verse 26, we'll note that passage of scripture in 1 Chronicles 5, and it's sad because we can read with regard to the, of course, the nation of Israel going into captivity and the nation of Judah going into captivity. But here in 1 Chronicles 5 and verse 26, it begins to record for us the captivity of the two and a half tribes that are on the east side of the Jordan. It's really recorded in verses 23 through 26, and in verse number 26 it says, or verse 25, it says, they transgressed against the God of their fathers and went a whoring after the gods of the people of the land whom God destroyed before them. The God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Paul, king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath Pilneser, king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even, notice the Reubenites
